Posts.Title: Very Confused (and slightly worried) Spooty barbe1958

Posts.Content: Nov 11, 2010 02:54PM Kam28 wrote: Scarlettsue, iam 34 and  i too lost my mom little over 3 years ago to breast cancer. So i'm very sensitive and scared about this issue. I also had cancer scare last year when they had to do biopsy BIRAD 4 and it was B9 ! Here are very nice, supportive and informative ladies. But i would just tell you to stay off the internet trying to research everything, its just gonna make you even more scared. That was my experience :-) Good luck and let us know. Praying for B9 results for you !
Posts.Title: 1.3 cm lump in breast lymph node scarlettsue0222 JellyShoes

Posts.Content: May 23, 2009 04:03PM Kam28 wrote: Jeannette, I'm so sorry you have to go through this. I just had my biopsy done 10 days ago for suspisious lumps birad 4 in my breast that showed on MRI. 6 months ago it was single nodule and at follow up it was three nodules so they requested biopsy. Just got results tuesday and it is BENIGN !!!!! Most of them turn out to be nothing, ... 80% !! I also have read that fibroadenoma can grow very quickly. I think they just want to make sure. And you are so young,...it can be anything. Good luck !! and keep us posted. kam

Posts.Title: I'm Back. Time for my 6 mos. MRI! Yikes! shabby6485 QueenK

Posts.Content: Jan 25, 2010 01:43PM Kam28 wrote: Hi, my frined had biopsy too with normal breast tissue and have 6 month follow up too. I just had my 6 months follow up MRI adn mammo and everything was fine. Thank God !! I was driving myself absolutely crazy prior my biopsy, try to read everything on the internet and spend hour reading it,(and the description of my findings was identical to cancer- so i really thought it's bad....my biopsy results were BENIGN)...and the reading didn't help and it actually made it wors ,..for me anyway. Would never do that again. I was tempting to do the same thing before my 6 months folow up ( to see if they sometimes can get bad results i guess) but then i said NO way,...just couldn't do it to myself. Try to relax and live your life and maybe MRI would be good idea to consider. I wish you good luck and little piece of mind.

Posts.Title: mri results, any experts on mri around? luvmyboy Kam28

Posts.Content: Jun 1, 2009 12:03PM Kam28 wrote: Hi, I'm 32 and I had suspisious MRI and even thought the radiologist was prette sure it was nothing she still wanted to do biopsy consider my family history....my mom was diagnosed at age 46 and passed away at age 49 after it had spread. It was 2 years ago.....It seems like it just happend. My biopsy results was NOT cancer. 80% of these biopsies are B-9 (not cancer!!!!) Good luck and let us know. Oh,...and the biopsy was just fine, it wasn't painful ..just presure....and even after it was ok. I was ok to take care of my 3 year old son and do everything else the nex day.
